answers.answer: Hello,These painful pin and needle sensations are called parasthesia.Spinal arthritis is an important cause of parasthesia.Other causes may be diabetes, stroke, multiple sclerosis and cerebrovascular accident.Buldging or herniated disc and peripheral neuropathy or peripheral nerve compression can also cause parasthesia in the back.Pls get your blood sugar evaluated.Also consult a neurologist and get CT head and spine done.If you are having a confirmed diagnosis of buldging disc,then pls get it evaluated by a neurologist.Spinal arthritis not responding to medical treatment can be  treated by surgery.Hope it helps.Take care and pls do keep me posted if you have any additional queries.

From a different perspective, you might want to consider have your vitamin levels checked, if you're going to be having bloodwork done, anyway. Vitamin B12 deficiency, as well as calcium deficiency are both notorious for causing "pins and needles" feelings in the extremities--though mostly the arms and hands.As for "RF liegioning"...I'm not familiar with this, but I'm guessing RF stands for Radio Frequency? Is there a potential that this could have caused some nerve damage, which is now causing the pain you're feeling? I'm not sure what it's used for in the first place, but I can guess...I just don't like the results when I weigh the positives against the negatives of having this procedure done, in my head.Regardless, I hope you start to feel better soon!

Any suggestions what is causing this?
